meanings.definition: Not able to be played or performed.
meanings.sent2: The old piano was unplayable due to missing keys.
meanings.sent3: The unplayable video game glitched every time the character moved.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was like an unplayable song, full of sorrow and silence.
meanings.sent5: The unplayable movie left the audience bored and restless.

meanings.definition: Not suitable or enjoyable to play.
meanings.sent1: The unplayable soccer field was covered in mud.
meanings.sent2: The broken toy was unplayable and no longer fun.
meanings.sent3: The unplayable board game had missing pieces and confusing rules.
meanings.sent4: His unplayable jokes fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The unplayable music was a cacophony of discordant sounds.
